org.openimaj.image.pixel.statistics

Class FStatisticalPixelProfileModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.pixel.statistics.FStatisticalPixelProfileModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PixelProfileModel<org.openimaj.image.FImage>

    public class FStatisticalPixelProfileModel
extends Object
implements PixelProfileModel<org.openimaj.image.FImage>
    An FStatisticalPixelProfileModel is a statistical model of pixels from an FImage sampled along a line. The model allows for various sampling strategies (see FLineSampler) and uses the mean and covariance as its internal state. The model is updateable, but does not hold on to previously seen samples to reduce memory usage.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

        public float computeMahalanobis(float[] vector)
        Compute the Mahalanobis distance of the given vector to the internal model. The vector must have the same size as the number of samples given during construction.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the computed Mahalanobis distance

      • computeMahalanobis

        public float computeMahalanobis(org.openimaj.image.FImage image,
                       org.openimaj.math.geometry.line.Line2d line)
        Compute the Mahalanobis distance of a vector of samples extracted along a line in the given image to the internal model.
        Parameters:

        line - the line to sample along
        Returns:
        the computed Mahalanobis distance

      • computeMahalanobisWindowed

        public float[] computeMahalanobisWindowed(org.openimaj.image.FImage image,
                                 org.openimaj.math.geometry.line.Line2d line,
                                 int numSamples)
        Extract numSamples samples from the line in the image and then compare this model at each overlapping position starting from the first sample at the beginning of the line. numSamples must be bigger than the number of samples used to construct the model. In addition, callers are responsible for ensuring the sampling rate between the new samples and the model is equal.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to sample
        line - the line to sample along
        numSamples - the number of samples to make
        Returns:
        an array of the computed Mahalanobis distances at each offset

      • computeNewBest

        public Point2d computeNewBest(org.openimaj.image.FImage image,
                     org.openimaj.math.geometry.line.Line2d line,
                     int numSamples)
        Description copied from interface: PixelProfileModel
        Extract numSamples samples from the line in the image and then compare this model at each overlapping position starting from the first sample at the beginning of the line. numSamples must be bigger than the number of samples used to construct the model. In addition, callers are responsible for ensuring the sampling rate between the new samples and the model is equal. The point on the line corresponding to the smallest Mahalanobis distance is returned.
        Specified by:
        computeNewBest in interface PixelProfileModel<org.openimaj.image.FImage>
        Parameters:
        image - the image to sample
        line - the line to sample along
        numSamples - the number of samples to make
        Returns:
        the "best" position on the line

      • computeMovementDistance

        public float computeMovementDistance(org.openimaj.image.FImage image,
                            org.openimaj.math.geometry.line.Line2d line,
                            int numSamples,
                            Point2d pt)
        Description copied from interface: PixelProfileModel
        Compute the distance between the centre of the given line and the given point, normalised as a function of the length of the sampling line.
        Specified by:
        computeMovementDistance in interface PixelProfileModel<org.openimaj.image.FImage>
        Parameters:
        image - the image to sample
        line - the line to sample along
        numSamples - the number of samples to make
        pt - the point to compare
        Returns:
        the normalised distance (0 means same point; 1 means on end of line)

      • computeMahalanobisWindowed

        public float[] computeMahalanobisWindowed(float[] vector)
        Compare this model at each overlapping position of the given vector starting from the first sample and return the distance for each overlap. The length of the vector must be bigger than the number of samples used to construct the model. In addition, callers are responsible for ensuring the sampling rate between the new samples and the model is equal.
        Parameters:
        vector - array of samples
        Returns:
        an array of the computed Mahalanobis distances at each offset
